Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price.
Reviews.Author: pdogmum
Reviews.Content: This was pretty easy to install (though I have no clue how to configure it for the remote viewing) but the drilling holes into the house and running the lines seemed to be pretty easy. Then hooking up the cables and connecting it to the router was also straight forward. I have had it up and running for a little over a month. My 500gb hard drive filled up completely. I have neighbors very close to me on all sides and am very close to the street. I also have some extremely horrid neighbors which has lead me to have to have it record all night long at times. I can't find a way to only have certain cameras record 24/7 and others only with motion so that uses up extra space. I had to buy a 1tb portable hard drive to transfer files. The included dvr appears to write over old files after it fills up. Has it helped with my horrid neighbor problem? Unfortunately, not. They are all aware of the cameras and they know that they do work but no one cares. I guess I wasn't lucky like some of the reviewers who stated certain people moved etc. Granted, it has only be a little over a month but still - I was very hopeful. I love my place but HATE my neighbors.When transferring your files onto a portable hard drive be aware that it takes forever. It also will have a huge box in the middle of your screen that you cannot minimize which will block your viewing that entire time. It took over 10hrs for me to transfer about a week's worth of files (and not necessarily the files that had the overnight recordings). Granted, could it be my portable hard drive or is it just how long it takes? I don't know.I have noticed an occasional flickering of the cameras - not sure what causes that. For me I feel that the recorded footage is good (but again everything that is being recorded is close). It doesn't seem to pick up animals (or at least rarely) which could be good or bad depending on what you need it to record for. Sometimes a bug flying very close to the cameras will cause it to start to record.All in all not a bad set. I bought them when they were $269.99 on Amazon and for that price I think they are very good.Edit: It has crashed 2 times since when I installed them in April though. I have no clue what caused it to happen each time. There was no problems with my power (electric) nor was there any issues with my internet. Hopefully, this isn't an occurring issue.

Reviews.Title: Worst customer service ever, call is sent to India. After getting to a real person they often disconnect you.
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: Before you buy this product try calling for yourself at the customer service number provided on the Q see web site. It takes about 30 minutes to get a real person on the line. The music on the line during the wait time is very loud, when you try to speak to someone you must yell and you cannot hear their voice.  Many times the person hung up on me and I had to start the process again.

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: FLP
Reviews.Content: The DVR and features are fine but the camera image quality isn't great.  I've tried to adjust the color but the end result regardless of what I do is black and white. I have a Foscam FI8910W and the image quality is far superior to these Q-See cameras.  If you want to see or track activity this system is fine.  If you want good quality images then pick another system.

Reviews.Title: Easy installation
Reviews.Author: Norman Guith
Reviews.Content: Easy installation; Easy hook ups;Having difficulty setting up the remote monitoring. Clear pictures.  For longer than 50 feet viewing, add a larger infrared light rated at 200-300 ft.

Reviews.Title: Just What Our Household Needed!
Reviews.Author: David Galipp "David G"
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review in stages - as I receive the product, unbox it, install it, and configure the setup I'll provide updates and helpful tips.First, I wanted to give everyone this link: (See comments, because Amazon deleted the link)This is an AMAZING YouTube video regarding installation of your Q-See System, including all of the technical details such as Port Forwarding, IP Configuration, etc.  No need to call your "techy" friend!So far, I'd recommend this product to any of my friends!---------------After unboxing the product, which was very well packed and organized, I hooked everything into the DVR system to ensure that I didn't have any duds - success!  Next, I mapped out the locations for my 8 cameras.  Optimally, I wanted one on each corner of my house, one on each side yard, and one on each main doorway.  I took rough estimates of how long each cable would need to be and determined that I needed a couple of 100' BNC - which is soon to be on its way.  This was determined on the location of the DVR, which will be high up in our master closet behind a fake wall.

Reviews.Title: Good camera system
Reviews.Author: Daniel L. McCollum
Reviews.Content: It does what I wanted it to do. I came with every thing I needed to install. It was easy to install and set up.

Reviews.Content: If you want good quality images then pick another system. very hard to use with 2wire and iphone. IR night vision is not good and really don't zoom just makes the pic bigger cant make much out day or night

Reviews.Title: Read , Recommend
Reviews.Author: esmeralda villanueva
Reviews.Content: Very Good Cameras ! Just What I Had Expected , Clear Picture Highly Recommend Easy To Install No Hassle Comes With Very Easy Instructions Too

Reviews.Title: satisfied, but not what I expected
Reviews.Author: GPawiro
Reviews.Content: Installation was very easy. live video image are perfect. Play back images are not so clear due to recording resolution. I had better bought a 700 tvl in stead of this with 480 tvl. Product is good for the price. Satisfied.

Reviews.Title: great for the price
Reviews.Author: timothy lewis mcdonald jr
Reviews.Content: Good system for residential maybe a small business easy to install if you have a little bit of knowledge about running wire in your attic not that great a quality of a picture but it gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: Great system
Reviews.Author: zemzem
Reviews.Content: Cameras are well build and have a metallic/aluminum casing. They have three dimensions of movements so you can get any desired position. The DVR comes with a pretty sophisticated OS, its packed with all kinds of features:1. remote view2. free dynamic dns management via qsee.com. This is helpful for remote viewing.3. Block out spots. If you want to block out certain areas of say a room for privacy the option is there.4. Search recording history5. Email notifications and alerts6. User and permission management to access the system remote/locally7. Automatic time sync via ntp servers.The camera line resolution could be better, but I am content for my basic setup. But because this system is modular you can upgrade your cameras later if you need to.DVR comes with usb/dvi/vga/ethernet out/in so you can connect your monitor/mouse/ethernet for full control.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: M. Juarez "Martin"
Reviews.Content: So far we installed 4 cameras and the image is amazing, it records all the time and it would keep the archives for a long time. I'd recommend it to anyone who wants to increase their security.

Reviews.Title: Works well and makes me feel safer
Reviews.Author: J. Baker "kairilily"
Reviews.Content: I actually took this system to our warehouse to set up as we've had some merchandise disappear lately.  Unfortunately, we are pre-wired for a different type of camera, so rather than rewire the warehouse, I brought these back home.  The good news is that it works well at my home.  My husband had no problem installing the system.  It did require some holes to be drilled and a good bit of cable to be ran, but it was nothing too difficult.  When everything was installed, he was like a kid with a new toy.  So far, the only thing we've had to watch is the cats outside and I hope it stays that way!  The system has made me feel much safer, especially when home alone.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: doglover
Reviews.Content: works very well i was satisfied with how good the quality is. The only problem i had was that the batteries in the remote only lasted half a day.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic product for your security needs.
Reviews.Author: L. Maupin "drop-dead-books"
Reviews.Content: This is an incredible device.  It includes 8 (yes, 8!) indoor/outdoor cameras.  The cameras record up to 50 feet away.  It comes with pre installed 500GB (yes 500 GB) hard drive)  It includes remote internet monitoring.  You can stream l.live directly to your PC or Mac, Ipad, Android or Iphone.  This is just unbelievable to me.  I have had these in the past and it did not include the features included here, but was the same price.  The pictures are unbelievably clear.The standard 60 foot cables are included with each camera  but you can add cable extensions also.  The cameras are also weatherproof. With 24 infrared LEDs at 0 lux, these cameras help you to see low to zero light.  Included  also  a pre-assembled, 3-axis mount for easy placement of the camera on a wall, ceiling, any other flat surface.  They have thought of everything. Fantastic product for your security needs.

Reviews.Title: Nice surveilance system""
Reviews.Author: Grandpa54
Reviews.Content: After recent vandals broke into my car I wanted a system that would keep an eye outside the house while I was sleeping and while im gone to keep an eye on everything.I figured this one would make a good choice.After unpacking and doing inventory I read the instructions(if you can believe that).Im a guy and most guys don't read the directions.I thought right away that this would be a job.Well,after about 8 hours or so I had it all hooked up and ready to try it.I turned it on and bingo, I had video on my monitor and it was working great.I like that I can monitor my house from work a lot.It makes me feel like I have some control over what happens at my home.I think anyone will be pleased with this setup.Its not to hard to install,just takes time and comes with everything you need.Hope this helps you in deciding.

Reviews.Title: Excellent security system.
Reviews.Author: Chrissy K. McVay "Writer"
Reviews.Content: We feel far more secure in our secluded mountain home with this security surveillance system. The weatherproof feature was extremely important because we have some wicked wind and ice storms here in the Blue Ridge Mountains. Although we are in a wooded area, we often have a problem with hunters trying to trespass, etc. so the 50 foot night vision range gives us extra peace of mind at night. Sometimes are dogs will bark and we simply can't see if it is anything to really worry about. This will help us see if it is just an animal or if we need to call the police. ADT wouldn't work as well for us because it is difficult to get up to our place in a timely fashion. The thieves would likely be gone before they were able to check things out. I like that the cameras are easily visible, letting the potential intruders know that they are being watched. On a more fun side to this, I look forward to catching some of the local black bears that wander through our yard on tape. At a later date we may upgrade to a wireless system, which we prefer, but for now this unit is everything we hoped it would be and we are quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Rather good economical video surveillance suite for home or business
Reviews.Author: Jed Shlackman
Reviews.Content: This Q-See security camera system offers quality imaging and recording at an affordable cost. It comes with 8 cameras and a DVR system that includes a 500 GB hard drive, along with the wiring and mounting to get things set up. This is the first time I've used a system like this, and for a beginner it isn't hard to set up. The video can also be streamed onto the Internet for you to view it from a remote location. The instructions that come with this are OK, the directions could be better for the software streaming capabilities since not everyone is that savvy with computer applications or mobile apps.The daytime recording is clear, as good as non-HD color TV quality, and the night vision is decent too, although the limitations of night vision mean that a person appearing in the video would be hard to identify unless they are relatively close to the camera. Since the cameras are weatherproof you can use them anywhere indoors or outdoors. While these are not wireless or HD, they seem to offer adequate image quality and reliability. A wired connection is actually more secure than wireless, meaning that nothing will interfere with the transmission unless a cable gets cut - wireless can more easily be disrupted. The 500 GB drive for the DVR is able to store a good amount of video data, since the video is TV quality rather than HD - the higher the video quality the more space it would consume.Years ago this type of system would have cost far more than it currently does - making the cost of this security measure more economical now. Q-See offers a variety of security systems, and this one offers features that keep the cost low while including enough cameras and recording space to make this sufficient for many homes and small businesses.

Reviews.Title: Nice security cameras
Reviews.Author: sandra villarreal
Reviews.Content: Great pictures & you can set up to do a lot of things with these cameras. great for large houses & large yards.

Reviews.Title: Could not wait to setup
Reviews.Author: cheryl ward
Reviews.Content: I was so glad to receive may package it was great. and easy to setup. instructions were easy to read and follow. thanks.
